question: Taylor stirs 2 grams of salt into a cup of water.  He then tries to get the salt back by evaporating the water.  In this experiment, the mass of salt recovered would be the same as the initial mass because

choices.choice: some of the salt evaporates with the water
salt does not evaporate with water
a chemical change occurred
salt does not dissolve in water

question: Sandy heated 20 grams of liquid hydrogen peroxide until it was completely broken down into liquid water and oxygen gas.  Which of these best describes the total mass of water and oxygen that was produced?

choices.choice: more than 20 grams since heat was added
20 grams since no matter was added or removed
less than 20 grams since oxygen gas is very light
more than 20 grams since there are two new substances

question: Which is the most basic unit of matter?

choices.choice: Compound
Element
mixture
molecure

question: What is the measure of the pull of gravity on an object?

choices.choice: Inertia
Mass
Pressure
Weight

question: What is the main function of an individual muscle cell?

choices.choice: to grow and repair tissues
to relax and contract tissues
to support and protect organs
to transmit and receive impulses

question: Which natural process results in offspring that are genetically identical to one parent?

choices.choice: Asexual reproduction
Complete metamorphosis
Sexual reproduction
incomplete metamorphosis

question: Which determines the state of matter of a substance?

choices.choice: Density
Temperature
Volume
Weight

question: A student flips a light switch but the light does not turn on. Based on this information, which inference is NOT valid?

choices.choice: The light switch is broken
The electrical connection is broken
The light bulb is burned out
The electrical wire is made of copper

question: What is Earth’s inner core made of?

choices.choice: Hot gases
Dense, solid metals
Partly-melted rock
Dense liquid materials

question: Why does an apple look red?

choices.choice: Red light waves are reflected by the apple
Red light waves are absorbed by the apple
Red light waves are reflected by a student’s eyes
Red light waves are absorbed by a student’s eyes

question: A scientist tests the effectiveness of a medicine. The medicine is administered to 2,500 volunteers who discontinue all other treatments. What is wrong with this experimental design?

choices.choice: The experiment should include fewer volunteers
The experiment should be administered in random dosages
The experiment should include a group that does not take the medicine
The experiment should allow the volunteers to continue other treatments

question: Which is NOT an example of a symbiotic relationship?

choices.choice: a tick biting a white-tailed deer
a caterpillar changing into a butterfly
a remora fish sticking to the shell of a sea turtle
a clownfish living within the parts of a sea anemone

question: A reflector helps people in cars see a bicycle when it is dark. How do bicycle reflectors work?

choices.choice: They bounce light back from other sources
They are covered with paint that glows in the dark
They are made of a special material that gives off its own light
They are connected to batteries that allow them to produce their own light

question: Which list has all terrestrial planets?

choices.choice: Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn
Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars
Mars, Saturn, Jupiter, Neptune
Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune

question: What is the original source of the energy released when fossil fuels are burned?

choices.choice: Decayed bacteria
Earth’s core
Nuclear
Solar

question: What did Robert Hooke use to view cells?

choices.choice: Tree Bark
Cork
Fuzz
Pea Plant

question: Who created the cell theory?

choices.choice: Robert Hooke
Antoine Van Leeuwenhoek
Schleiden
Alessandro Volta

question: Which one of these is the fourth step of the scientific method?

choices.choice: Gather Information
Analyze/Conclusion
Form Hypothesis
Test Hypothesis with an Experiment

question: The combination of sex chromosomes that produces a male:

choices.choice: XX
XY
XXX
XO

question: A scientist studied a species of fish. She found that when a certain nutrient was added to the diet of the fish just after hatching, the fish gained an average of 3 kilograms in the first year. What additional information is needed to determine whether the nutrient is affecting the growth of the fish

choices.choice: how much adult fish gained on average when the same nutrient was added to their diet
how much newly hatched fish in this species gain in the first year without the nutrient in their diet
how much of the nutrient is available for the fish species in their natural surroundings
how much other species of fish gain in the first year when the nutrient is added to their diet

question: A scientist discovers that a certain substance will be useful in treating nerve damage. What is the best way she can communicate her results to the scientific community?

choices.choice: She can call other scientists who also work in nerve research
She can write a letter to hospitals that treat patients with nerve damage
She can put her conclusions on a Web site that focuses on the nervous system.
She can publish her results in a scientific journal that covers issues relating to nerves

question: Leslie’s science teacher told her she must take a flexible approach to solving problems. What did Leslie’s teacher most likely mean?

choices.choice: Leslie should not follow the experimental instructions exactly
Leslie should only write down lab results that seem to be correct
Leslie should accept all scientific theories even if they have been proven wrong
Leslie should be willing to consider many possible causes for her observations.

question: A scientist plans to investigate the nervous system of sea slugs. What should the scientist do first?

choices.choice: Develop a theory about sea slugs that can be tested
Develop a theory about sea slugs that can be tested
Obtain several sea slugs and conduct experiments with them
Review the research other scientists have done on sea slugs

question: Researchers recently discovered a gene in humans that previously was unknown to science. Which statement best explains why the gene probably was not discovered much sooner?

choices.choice: The gene only recently evolved in humans
The technology used to study genes is still being developed
Scientists were not interested in genes until a few years ago
Scientists were sure they had already discovered every possible gene

question: A scientist studied the number of eggs a species of bird lays each year. He found that the most common number of eggs laid in a year is three. Which statistical measurement did the scientist find?

choices.choice: the mean number of eggs laid in a year
the median number of eggs laid in a year
the mode of the number of eggs laid in a year
the range of the number of eggs laid in a year

question: Joanne’s science teacher cautioned the class to be skeptical when learning about new scientific discoveries. Why is it important to be skeptical about new discoveries in science?

choices.choice: because many scientific discoveries are not based on facts
because most scientific discoveries have no scientific value
because most scientists make errors when formulating scientific discoveries
because all scientific discoveries must be examined critically before they can be accepted

question: Louis Pasteur discovered that the bacteria in a substance can be killed by heating the substance for a short period of time. Which of these practices benefited most from Pasteur’s discovery?

choices.choice: storing foods for longer periods of time
building ovens and other heating devices
creating medicines that cure infections
transporting living organisms without injuring them

question: In which situation would osmosis most likely occur in cells?

choices.choice: across a permeable membrane that separates solutions of the same concentration
across a permeable membrane that separates solutions of different concentrations
across a nonpermeable membrane that separates solutions of the same concentration
across a nonpermeable membrane that separates solutions of different concentrations

question: Which statement best describes the process of respiration?

choices.choice: Oxygen and sugar are used in the process that provides energy to cells; water and carbon dioxide are its waste products
Water and sugar are used to in the process that provides energy to cells; oxygen and carbon dioxide are its waste products
Oxygen and carbon dioxide are used in the process that provides energy to cells; sugar and water are its waste products
Carbon dioxide and sugar are used in the process that provides energy to cells; water and oxygen are its waste products

question: What is a difference between mitosis and meiosis?

choices.choice: Mitosis occurs in all the cells in animals and plants, while meiosis occurs in only in bacteria
In mitosis, the products are identical to the parent cell, while in meiosis the products are different from the parent cell
In mitosis, one cell divides into two cells, while in meiosis two cells combine to make one cell
Mitosis involves separating the chromosomes, while meiosis involves only the cytoplasm of the cell

question: In humans, B is the allele for brown eyes and b is the allele for blue eyes. Two brothers both have brown eyes, but one of them has both the B and b alleles while the other only has B alleles. Which statement is true about the brothers?

choices.choice: They have the same genotype and phenotype
They have different phenotypes and genotypes
They have the same phenotype but different genotypes
They have the same genotype but different phenotypes

question: What do scientists mean when they refer to a population?

choices.choice: all the organisms in an ecosystem
all the species that share similar anatomical features
all the animals that acquire resources through similar methods
all the interbreeding members of a certain species in an ecosystem

question: Which relationship is mutualistic?

choices.choice: an insect that lives and feeds on the body of an alligator
an ant that lives on a plant and defends the plant from other insects
a bird that migrates to follow the movements of the butterflies that it eats
a deer that eats one kind of plant, which allows another kind of plant to grow in its place

question: Which example describes a behavioral adaptation?

choices.choice: A bird builds its nest in the ash near a volcano
A whale has the ability to hold its breath for 20 minutes
A fox’s hair is white in the winter and brown in the summer
A monkey has long arms that allow it to swing from one branch to another

question: A forest is flooded when a natural dam breaks, leaving the forest floor under two meters of water. Which animal is most affected by the flooding?

choices.choice: a crow
a rabbit
a squirrel
a butterfly

question: Which resource is most likely found in large amounts in forest ecosystems?

choices.choice: Iron
Wood
plastic
petroleum

question: In a large forest with many animals, there are only a small number of bears. Which of these most likely limits the population of bears in the forest?

choices.choice: supply of food
type of tree
predation by carnivores
amount of suitable shelter

question: What is the main reason humans need nitrogen to survive

choices.choice: Nitrogen is used in respiration to generate energy
Nitrogen is used in making the proteins in the body
Nitrogen is used to help the body eliminate wastes
Nitrogen is used by nerve cells to conduct impulses

question: Which statement best describes the roles of photosynthesis and respiration in the carbon cycle?

choices.choice: Respiration and photosynthesis both add carbon to the atmosphere
Respiration and photosynthesis both remove carbon from the atmosphere
Respiration adds carbon to the atmosphere, while photosynthesis removes carbon from the atmosphere
Photosynthesis adds carbon to the atmosphere, while respiration removes carbon from the atmosphere

question: Scientists have observed an increase in global temperatures over the past 100 years. Which phenomena do scientists believe contributes to the increase in temperatures?

choices.choice: an increase in undersea volcanic activity
a decrease in the distance between Earth and the Sun
an increase in certain gases released during the use of fossil fuels
a decrease in the amount of water on Earth due to overconsumption

question: Once a scientific theory has withstood numerous tests and accurately predicted future observations, it may be elevated to the level of ______.

choices.choice: A natural law
An idea
a hypothesis
an example of deductive reasoning

question: Absorption is taken in or sucking up liquids or gases, while effervescence is _____.

choices.choice: Absorption is taken in or sucking up liquids or gases, while effervescence is _____.
Sucking up liquids
Giving of Bubbles in gas
Taking in gases

question: Which is the first thing that would happen if a plant could NOT obtain carbon dioxide?

choices.choice: It would not be able to reproduce
It would not be able to make food
It would not be able to get rid of waste
It would not be able to absorb minerals

question: Plants absorb light energy and store that energy in the form of ____

choices.choice: Waters
Carbon Dioxide
Sugar
Oxygen

question: Kim wanted to determine if certain seeds require sunlight to germinate. She placed one seed in a moist paper towel in the sunlight and another seed in an equally moistened paper towel in a dark closet. The seed in the sunlight germinated but the one in the closet did not. Kim reported to the class that this type of seed needs sunlight in order to germinate. Given this information, which statement would best describe an improvement in Kim’s experiment that would strengthen her claim?

choices.choice: Use many seeds to conduct the experiment
Start the samples on different days
Use different amounts of water
Place the seeds in new locations

question: Which process will produce igneous rocks?

choices.choice: deposition of sediments
volcanic action
earthquake activity
erosion of surface rocks

question: Which motion describes molecules in a solid at extremely low temperatures?

choices.choice: bumping together with some room to move
vibrating while closely packed together
moving freely and randomly in a space
sliding around one another and colliding

question: Cindy dissected a flowering plant and looked at the stem, roots, leaves, and flower using a microscope. After her observations, Cindy should conclude that all flowering plant structures

choices.choice: are not living
have the same function
have cells
are green

question: Which of the following describes the greatest flaw with the experimental design?

choices.choice: the test results were recorded
the volunteer went to sleep
the study was done overnight
only one volunteer participated
